comments:
The reason I submitted this under JDT Core is because the message that causes 
this comes originally from there (actually JDT Launching).

I switched from IBM Java 1.3.0 to the new IBM Java 1.3.1. I installed it in a 
new directory.

When I started Eclipse with the new VM, the JRE_LIB still pointed to the old 
one, it didn't switch to the one I started Eclipse with, which is what I had 
expected it to do. So I removed the old JVM directory (renamed it really) and 
now Eclipse won't start. I get the following in the .log file which then 
prevents Eclipse from coming up. It goes down then (though Eclipse.exe doesn't 
sense this and it stays up until I get task manager to kill it).

The first few lines of the .log output are:

2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Duplicate VM: 0
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMInstallType.createVMInstall
(AbstractVMInstallType.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.detectVMConfiguration
(JavaRuntime.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.getDefaultVMInstall
(JavaRuntime.java:251)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.initializeJREVariables
(JavaRuntime.java:556)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.JavaPlugin$1.run(JavaPlugin.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
(Workspace.java:1232)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.JavaPlugin.startup(JavaPlugin.java:204)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor$1.run
(PluginDescriptor.java:701)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:817)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.internalDoPluginActivation
(PluginDescriptor.java:713)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.doPluginActivation
(PluginDescriptor.java:184)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.activatePlugin
(PluginClassLoader.java:52)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.findClassParentsSelf
(PluginClassLoader.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.loadClass
(DelegatingURLClassLoader.java(Compiled Code))

There are then several more traces as this one causes other plugins to fail and 
eventually causes Eclipse to fail and then exit.

I'll attach the entire log for you.

Thanks

Created an attachment (id=468)
The .log file from the error.

I think I now understand why when both JVM's were existing it didn't 
automatically change the JRE_LIB to the jvm that eclipse was started with. If 
it did do the change then a complete recompile is needed because it sees it as 
a different JDK.

But if the old JDK is gone, it really should switch it and not throw an 
exception and not come up.

Thanks
launching is now contributed by Debug
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 12204 ***
